comment: TAKE HIM!! Overall a great professor. Super caring and understanding. Concepts are very easy. You watch videos for the chapter and have one homework assignment for it (the assignment is set up so you have unlimited attempts making it easy to get a 100). Watching the videos is a part of your grade. For exams, he posts very helpful reviews. Got an A.

Definitely take this prof. He assigns videos to teach via Aleks, with 1 homework assignment per chapter. There are 3 exams, which you are able to use a notes sheet for reference, and 1 final. If you have any questions, he is happy to answer them and genuinely strives to help his students exceed. Also provides a grade calculator to reference
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Morris really is a great teacher. His lectures are easy to follow and he makes it very clear what is on each test so that you are never surprised by anything. Uses lockdown browser for all three test, but just do the homework and watch the review video before the test and you should be fine.

Took him for summer semester. Great lecture videos with completed notes posted. They are long but watch in 1.5x or 2x and its a breeze. Not a crazy amount of hw but it is graded and helpful. Only a couple tests/quizzes. Quiz is open note. Test has formula sheet. Posts study guides for each unit. Always answers emails. TAKE HIM!!

He remembers being a student and applies it to his teaching. Attendance isn't required, but it can affect if your grade gets rounded up at the end of the semester. Lectures are posted online after each class. Test reviews and study guides make tests pretty easy. Worked with me when I needed to make up a test. Doesn't make you buy the textbook.

I don't normally like lectures, but he is very engaging. If you miss the lectures, he also posts them. Additionally, if you study and attend lectures regularly, then you will pass all the quizzes and exams.

One of the best professors i've had at KSU. He records all his lectures so its easy to go back and review if you're not a great note taker. He's very helpful and gives good instruction.
 I did poorly most of the semester (not a good test taker) but I still feel like I learned more in this class than any other class so far.

Amazing! I would take every class with him if I could! He gives you everything you need to succeed, retakes for tests available, bonus questions, answers to everything in his notes, allows you to use his notes on quizzes, final is optional, attendance is optional. He was the best and cares about his students' success.

He's such a chill and flexible professor. The material that's gonna be on the tests and quizzes is clear and his D2L is very organized. He didn't require his students to purchase the textbook or do the homework, on the condition that he would replace your hw grade with your quiz average. Definitely recommend taking this professor.

I took this class with Professor Morris and absolutely loved it! Professor Morris is so kind, responds to emails, and is so helpful with anything you need. He made this subject enjoyable (even though I'm a bio major).His exams are like his practice exams and examples from lecture.

Prof. Morris understands what it's like to be a student. He doesn't give busy work, and gives very concise lectures and will end class early. His tests are very reflective of the review he gives beforehand. Homework is optional (not worth it imo). Pretty chill guy! Attend class, and you'll be set.

One of the best professors I have ever had, who had amazing organization skills like I have never seen before and who made a class I never enjoyed before actually interesting. Take Professor Morris for any class you can, if only all professors were like him this school would actually be worth it. You are not required to do homework which is nice.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: Professor Morris is a great professor. He is very accessible and he's willing to help if you don't understand something. I highly recommend him. We used a program called R studio which can be quite frustrating when doing the homework but he made it much easier to learn. The test are a mix of multiple choice and free answer, just study!

Steve Morris is so great! One of the kindest and most understanding professors I have had in college. He gives VERY helpful study guides. There are coding homework assignments, but he gives examples of the code in class. TAKE HIM! HE IS GREAT!
STAT 2332: Unit reviews for each test make studying easy. Easy material and great teacher in class anyway. Very flexible with assignments. Very available outside class.

If you're looking for a great professor who gives study guides very similar to the exams with online videos completing them, then take this professor. He is a great guy. I wouldn't have wanted to take this class with anyone else. He posts his lectures online. Attendance is not mandatory. Just take him

Genuinely great guy. He's knowledgeable on the material and brings real-world experience to the classroom. Always willing to help and was readily available outside/after class. Clear expectations on assignments, but was also very flexible. Highly recommend taking any class you can with him. (Took STAT 3120, not 3125)

One of the best professors at KSU.  Tests are based off review sheets, he gives formulas and allows calculator use, quizzes are open note, and the RStudio portions are very well defined.  No surprises on any exams; his class was stress free. 10/10 would take him again for anything.

Do yourself a favor: take him for any statistics class. No regrets

Definitely take Professor Morris if possible. Really cares about his students and you can tell he's a genuine person. His quizzes were open note, he posts all of his lecture notes online along with the lectures. If you study the lecture notes you will do well on the tests. A must take if you have to take Stat 2332.

Fantastic Professor!!!!! Make a genuine effort and you will earn an A. He tells you exactly what you need to know. If you don't know it, it's your fault. Plenty of extra credit opportunities. Homework is optional. Show up to class, as he randomly gives codewords for quizzes for extra credit. I'd 100% get a beer with him if that says anything.

Loved Prof Morris' class. Class was enjoyable and workload was very manageable. Always accessible for questions. Always tries to put his students in positions so they can succeed. Lots of extra credit/bonus opportunities. 100% would take him for stat 2332.
Take him if you can. Gives practice tests that are just like the exam. Only 2 quizzes. The coding assignments are not too bad, he gives the code in class. Very nice and chill guy.

This class was an easy A. Lecture notes are straight forward and the content that's going to be on the tests is made clear in the study guide. All notes from class, study guides and video recordings are posted online. He also gave many ways to boost grades.

Take this man. He cares about his students and his notes are clear and straight to the point. He has a retest opportunity to gain back some points for one of your tests. All tests are 95% multiple choice and his study guides are almost replicas of the main test. Great professor.
Just take him, don't waste your time. I've learned so much without giving a huge headache

The best professor I have ever had. Super understanding, caring, and smart. He obviously wants his students to succeed. Also the material is not hard if you attend class. Really great professor and gave me a great experience. A nice break in a sea of professors that want their students to fail.

Easiest class!!! All you need is his notes to get over a 100 in this class. There's a lot of extra credit for showing up to class when not many people show. He is young and teaches how students want to be taught. SO straightforward. Absolutely no tricks, questions are straight from notes. He records and posts lectures online. super approachable.
hes super caring and understanding. if you pay attention in class and take notes, you will pass. I would definitely take him again.

Morris was one of my best professors i've taken so far. He's one of the few professors I feel really care about his student's understanding. Class is not mandatory, but you receive extra credit for showing up. He posts his own textbook and doesn't make you buy scantrons. He's very accessible if you have any questions, but posts all the notes. 10/10

Mr. Morris was an excellent math teacher! He will help you on the spot if you have any question or concerns. During the pandemic, just as great! He has 4 quizzes and 4 tests for the semester. My key to pass his tests/quizzes was what ever he says during notes, WRITE IT DOWN. Even if he does not write it. It has saved my butt tons of times.

Mr. Morris is amazing. He understands that everyone isnt a stats major. He gives extra credit by showing up, tests and quizzes are exactly like the study guides and he helps give straight forward answers. Honestly top 3 best professors at kennesaw and actually helps when you need it. TAKE HIM!!!

This is the best professor I have taken at KSU so far. He will go out of his way to help you and if you go to class, you will get an A. He makes information easy to understand and is very organized with notes. His quizzes and tests only contain material that is gone over in class. TAKE HIM!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Morris was one of the best professors I've ever had. I took his Stats class and he is well aware that everyone in there is not a math major and just took the easier alternative to Calc, so he makes it easy on you. There are open note quizzes and then tests, all multiple choice. He doesn't give homework. Posts notes online. Great prof

Prof. Morris was awesome. Attendance isn't mandatory except for test days, and he teaches in way that was super simple to understand. Definitely a very good class to knock out the math requirement for your gen ed. Also, the dude is pretty funny and relaxed. Felt more like a colleague than a professor, in a good way.
Take him! If you go to class and pay attention you will pass!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He's really chill and cares about his students, if you struggle or are scared of taking stats take him! He talks really monotone in class but if you just take good notes you'll be okay. He gives a bunch of test loopholes to make sure you pass. Also answers e-mails on the weekend he's great!

I usually dont make accounts and post reviews but he was the best. Got an A in the class whereas I have failed and retaken my other math classes. He will stay after class for way too long to help you out. I loved him. He also posts everything he does in class on D2L afterwards.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Morris is a caring professor that goes out of his way to answer questions before, during, and after class. He provides helpful outlines and is clear as to what you'd see on a test. I'm awful when it comes to math, but Morris made this class enjoyable. Oh, and not to mention he's easy on the eyes with a deep voice. He is heaven sent. Take him!

He provides equation sheets on all of your tests. You don't have to take his final if you don't want to & allows you to makeup whatever test you want at the end of the semester. He gives homework and quizzes, but nothing too over the top. He goes over study guides and goes over the test after the exam day. He really tries to help you succeed
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: GREAT PROFESSOR!! Very caring.

I am genuinely sad that Morris does not teach my major. The best professor I've had by far. He is very laidback and likeable. Basically, 3 unit tests, a few chapter  quizzes, and webassign HW. attendance isn't mandatory, he allows a test retake at the end of the semester,  final is optional. Take him!!!

Prof Morris was amazing. He made stats easy to understand, attendance isn't mandatory and gives extra credit. The final is optional and he drops a few low scores. He's very approachable and funny. Take his class!!!!

Math is my least favorite & weekest subject, but I loved his class and I really learned from him. He makes sense and teaches well to people who don't pick up on math easily. He's super nice and gives extra credit opportunities. He's funny, doesn't throw harsh curveballs on his tests, and gives short, easy hw assignments.

literally best prof. i've ever had! i actually went to his class not because i didn't understand the material, but because i genuinely enjoyed his class lectures! also his voice is super deep and soothing and omg i loved this class!!!

In addition to being hot and having a lovely deep voice, this guy is a good professor. He posts all of the outlines he fills out on D2L, so it is not mandatory to attend class. Attendance isn't mandatory either. Morris assigns hw on Webassign. He is a very caring and laid back guy, who is always willing to help. Would definitely take him again

AMAZING professor. He knows this is an intro class and teaches as so. He makes it clear of whats going to be on the test that you can only fail if you honestly dont try at all. Gives extra credit so much it makes no sense. Is very caring about his students and very understanding. I highly recommend

I'm horrible at math and went only on test days, and received a 105 in this class. He posts outlines of the notes before class then posts the filled in notes after class. Incredibly clear and simplifies everything to where it makes sense. 4 Quizzes, 3 Tests, allows a test retake, and optional final.  Would definitely recommend taking this class!
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This dude is a fallen angel. Makes statistics super easy to understand. The first day of class he said he will never read to a literate crowd and he stuck to that. We never stayed the whole class time because as soon as he taught the unit he let us go. Always out at least 15 minutes early. (His voice is also super deep and lovely to listen to)
